intro: Pseudogaltonia liliiflora, commonly known as the Lily-flowered Aloe, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features narrow, upright leaves that are typically blue-green in color, with a textured surface. The plant produces striking, showy inflorescences of white to pink flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
